headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; Passage of a Bogus Homestead Bill in the Senate. The House Abrogates the Slavery Code of New-Mexico. A Broil Between two Indiana Representatives. docs.snippet: COMMISSIONERS OF EMIGRATION. The Commissioners of Emigration held their weekly session on Wednesday afternoon, at Castle Garden. A full Board present Mr. VERPLANCK, the President, in the Chair. Mr. VERPLANCK asked how much was owing to different...
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMISSIONERS OF EMIGRATION. The Commissioners of Emigration held their weekly session on Wednesday afternoon, at Castle Garden. A full Board present Mr. VERPLANCK, the President, in the Chair. Mr. VERPLANCK asked how much was owing to different counties of the State for supplies furnished emigrants, and the care of them during detention by sickness, in passing through their counties.

headline.main: THE ANNIVERSARIES.; THE BIBLE AND TRACT INTERESTS. WOMEN'S RIGHTS AND WRONGS. THE CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS THE AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY. LETTER FROM LORD SHAFTESBURY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The annual business meeting of the American Bible Society was held at 9 o'clock yesterday morning, at the Bible House, Hon. THEO. FRELINGHUYSEN in the Chair, supported by a number of Vice-Presidents. After prayer by Rev. WALTER CLARKE, the President appointed Francis Hall, Dr. Butler, James Brown, Wm. W. Chester and Horace Holden to nominate candidates for the office of Managers.

docs.snippet: Dispatches received at the French Legation announce that the new Minister will leave Havre for the United States about the 10th of June. Vicomte TREILLIARD will then retire from this mission.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dispatches received at the French Legation announce that the new Minister will leave Havre for the United States about the 10th of June. Vicomte TREILLIARD will then retire from this mission.

headline.main: THE JAPANESE IN AMERICA.; Arrival of the United States Steam Frigate off this Port. The Ambassadors in Oriental Waters. THE TRANSIT OF THE ISTHMUS. First Experience of Railway Traveling. Courtesies of the New-Grenadian Authorities. Reception of the Strangers on Board the Roanoke. The Steamer to Proceed this Morning to Hampton Roads. FROM OUR SPECIAL REPORTER. UNITED STATES STEAM FRIGATE ROANOKE,

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States steam frigate Roanoke, flagship of Flag-officer WM. J. McCLUNEY, Commander-in-Chief of the Home and Gulf Squadron, arrived at Sandy Hook last evening, in 13 days from Aspinwall, and 12 days from Porto Bello, at which latter place she stopped 24 hours for a supply of water.

docs.snippet: The United States frigate Roanoke, from Aspinwall on the 26th ult., with the Embassy dispatched by the Court of Jeddo to Washington, arrived at Sandy Hook last evening. Her Commander was then intercepted by dispatches from the Navy Department...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States frigate Roanoke, from Aspinwall on the 26th ult., with the Embassy dispatched by the Court of Jeddo to Washington, arrived at Sandy Hook last evening. Her Commander was then intercepted by dispatches from the Navy Department directing him to proceed at Hampton Roads, where a vessel would be in readiness to receive his illustrious, but outlandish passengers,

byline.original: Special Dispatch to the New-York Times

docs.snippet: THE FEDERAL OFFICE-HOLDERS IN NEW-YORK. Peremptory orders have gone forth to Post  master FOWLER, and the other office-holders in NewYork, instructing them to call a meeting forthwith at Tammany, for the purpose of denouncing Popular Sovereignty, and...

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; Senators Clingman and Benjamin on Slave-Property in the Territories.The Course of the CharlestonBolters Justified.THE TARIFF BILL IN THE HOUSE.Arguments for and Against the New Measure.The New-York Office-holders UnderDiscipline. From the Associated Press. SENATE.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE FEDERAL OFFICE-HOLDERS IN NEW-YORK. Peremptory orders have gone forth to Post master FOWLER, and the other office-holders in NewYork, instructing them to call a meeting forthwith at Tammany, for the purpose of denouncing Popular Sovereignty, and taking other measures to kill off DOUGLAS. Any one who shall refuse to join in the call and proceedings will be instantly removed from office.

headline.main: CITY INTELLIGENCE.; Police Reports. AN UNFORTUNATE PARTNERSHIP. Coroners' Inquests. SUICIDE OF AN INVALID.

docs.lead_paragraph: ANNUAL MEETING OF THE MERCANTILE LIBRARY ASSOCIATION. The members of the Mercantile Library Association held their annual meeting last evening in the lecture-room of the library building. There was a large attendance the body of the room being occupied by young members of the Association, and the platform by several members of the Board of Directors. GEO. W. BLUNT, Esq., presided. The annual report was first read.
